item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Redis is open source again (106 points | 19 comments)
2. We identified a North Korean hacker who tried to get a job at Kraken (123 points | 86 comments)
3. A faster way to copy SQLite databases between computers (238 points | 121 comments)
4. Linkwarden: FOSS self-hostable bookmarking with AI-tagging and page archival (94 points | 37 comments)
5. Judge Rules Apple Executive Lied Under Oath, Makes Criminal Contempt Referral (401 points | 124 comments)
6. Starting July 1, Academic Publishers Can't Paywall NIH-Funded Research (73 points | 8 comments)
7. Show HN: Mechanical Computer Kit (Roons) (7 points | discuss)
8. Trust Me, I'm Local: Chrome Extensions, MCP, and the Sandbox Escape (68 points | 20 comments)
9. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (516 points | 682 comments)
10. Vanguard 50-year anniversary CEO letter (115 points | 111 comments)
11. The term "vegetative electron microscopy" keeps showing up in scientific papers (49 points | 5 comments)
12. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (393 points | 112 comments)
13. How to vibe code for free: Running Qwen3 on your Mac, using MLX (139 points | 100 comments)
14. Show HN: Hyperparam: OSS Tools for Exploring Datasets Locally in the Browser (24 points | 15 comments)
15. International Workers' Day (183 points | 57 comments)
16. Why some Mac apps launch slowly: A follow-up (26 points | discuss)
17. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (359 points | 153 comments)
18. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (987 points | 451 comments)
19. The one interview question that will protect you from North Korean fake workers (149 points | 113 comments)
20. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (282 points | 46 comments)
21. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (226 points | 157 comments)
22. All roses were once yellow (18 points | 1 comment)
23. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (352 points | 320 comments)
24. The Brief Origins of May Day (143 points | 159 comments)
25. If you're in the market for a $1,900 color E Ink monitor, one of them exists now (48 points | 39 comments)
26. All four major web browsers are about to lose 80% of their funding (524 points | 523 comments)
27. Linux Kernel Exploitation: Attack of the Vsock (221 points | 65 comments)
28. When ChatGPT Broke an Entire Field: An Oral History (21 points | 1 comment)
29. Zhaoxin's KX-7000 (176 points | 45 comments)
30. I created Perfect Wiki and reached $250k in annual revenue without investors (671 points | 382 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
